title: Is it a good idea to read multiple books at the same time? - Quora

response.answer_text: I always do this, and most of the people that I know who would consider reading their "main" hobby do this as well, to some extent. It's never seemed unusual to me. A long time ago I used to have a rule of not reading more than one novel at a time, because I thought I'd get confused or forget things, but I haven't been following that rule for at least a couple years and it's been totally fine.  Right now I'm reading: October Country by Ray BradburyScarlet by Marissa MeyerPerdido Street Station by China MievilleThe Rape of Nanking by Iris ChangTrigger Warning by Neil GaimanWriters of the Future, Volume 30The Book of Mormon (A companion to the musical, not the religious text)I think a lot of it comes down to your memory. Are you the kind of person that's going to forget what's going on in a novel if you haven't picked it up in a week? If so, you probably can't do this sort of thing. I can put a novel down for months and remember exactly what's going on when I pick it back up again, so I have no anxiety about reading lots of things at once. If I get distracted and put a book down for a while, I know I'll almost always be able to come back to it without starting over.

right now i am reading dune snow blind foundation for whom the bell tolls the great gatsby the brothers karamasov the prophet armed robert service stalin of mice and men the reason is…some of the books have boring parts…some are hard to get really going..and i like variety…some days i want serious, others i want total fiction.. my mood changes from day to day and hour to hour…and it is great to grab whatever suits my mood. if one gets ultra exciting, i will read it for several days until that changes…today i have read parts of 3 of them. if it makes you happy and helps you conquer the books..then why not. that said…if i dont like a book or i am not really getting anything from it …i bin it…there are too many good books out there to torture yourself reading shit you dont like. as i get through some of the books …i will add more, it is a great way to read…dont restrict yourself to one book at a time…unless the book is amazing. and you can never know if a book is amazing until you have given it at least 100 pages.
